title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: The New England Patriots may cut Stefon Diggs, saving $16.8 million, due to his $20 million salary with only $1.7 million guaranteed.
Wide receivers DeMario Douglas, Mack Hollins, and Kayshon Boutte could be cut or traded, with savings between $3 to $4 million each.
Morgan Moses, Christian Elliss, and Garrett Bradbury are also potential cut candidates, potentially saving the Patriots several million in cap space.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum remains out as he recovers from an Achilles injury suffered last May against the Knicks.
Joel Embiid will miss the Celtics vs. 76ers game due to an oblique strain, expected out for three games.
Sunday's game marks the end of the Celtics-76ers regular-season series; Celtics lead the East standings.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran has hit three home runs in the first week of spring training, including two against left-handed pitchers.
The Red Sox outfielder hit two home runs against the Twins, impressing with a 401-foot and a 409-foot shot.
Duran's spring performance could earn him a stronger role in Boston's lineup, potentially as designated hitter or in the three spot.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: James Hagens and Dean Letourneau scored a combined 39 goals for Boston College in the current season.
Seven Bruins draftees participated in the BC-BU hockey match; BU defeated BC 3-1.
The Bruins' prospect pool strengthens with Hagens and Letourneau showing significant progress at BC.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: An unnamed Western Conference assistant coach considers the Celtics favorites to win the East despite trailing the Pistons.
The Celtics have been strong since Thanksgiving, boasting a league-leading 9.9 net rating and a 29-11 record.
Celtics, positioned second in the East, could benefit from adding Jayson Tatum, boosting offensive capabilities.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed a mix of new and classic tracks at Boston's Boch Center Wang Theatre.
The concert included covers and songs from all stages of Isbell's career, showcasing his Americana influences.
The band alternated between energetic full-band songs and solemn acoustic numbers, maintaining variety throughout the set.

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are unlikely to secure top edge rushers in free agency due to financial constraints.
Maxx Crosby's potential trade remains uncertain as the Raiders may retain him until the NFL Draft.
The Patriots might pursue edge rusher prospects like Missouri's Zion Young in the upcoming NFL Draft.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance is purchasing Warner Bros. Discovery for $110 billion, with potential partial integration of CBS and TNT/TBS networks.
The deal could enhance CBS's MLB and NHL broadcasts, expanding platforms for college football under the Warner Bros. Discovery umbrella.
Netflix may retaliate in future NFL broadcast deals after withdrawing from the Warner Bros. Discovery purchase bidding.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots interested in A.J. Brown but consider Eagles' current trade asking price too high, per reports.
Trading A.J. Brown before June 1 would cost Eagles $44 million in dead money, $20 million in cap space.
Patriots may keep Stefon Diggs and trade for Brown, possibly requiring Diggs to restructure his contract.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts is switching from plastic transponders to windshield sticker tags for E-ZPass toll collection starting Sunday.
The new E-ZPass stickers, featuring RFID technology, will be free for customers, and current transponders remain functional.
MassDOT expects the sticker transition to save $7.4 million annually, as production costs drop from $6.70 to 55 cents per tag.
